See also ‘Can Fictional Narratives be True?’, where Ricoeur expands on Kant’s analysis of the productive imagination. Ricoeur’s major critique Notes of Kant, which I endorse, is that by confining the narrative functions of synthesis and schematism to the inner sense of imagination, he ignores the essentially ‘intersubjective’ aspect of narrative
